description:
Job Responsibilities

  • Experience on MRB (Material review board) activities, NCs (Non conformances), QN (Quality notifications), Concessions of metallic parts/structures.
  • Experience on detailed sizing of metallic parts/structures including Static, Fatigue of repairs/alterations/NCs using classical hand calculations.
  • Should have experience of creating substantiation of Non conformances on engine/ structural metallic component. Metallic Material properties knowledge is a must.
  • Knowledge of elastomers (seals, diaphragms) and assemblies, fluid systems, electronic components are an added advantage.
  • Tools Knowledge: CAD modelling, SAP, PDM, Catia V5 (optional), SolidWorks and EPDM, FEM modelling, Ansys, tolerance stack analysis, MS word, MS excel, Mathcad.
  • Aerospace structural/engines/Systems knowledge is an added advantage. Experience on aircraft components certification report and evaluation of the NCs (non-conformances).
  • FAA, and EASA specifications knowledge is an added advantage.
  • Should be able to communicate and collaborate between different stakeholders (airworthiness teams, Quality team, manufacturing team, design team, stress team, vendors, suppliers etc.).
  • Experience of managing out of box returns – (OOB) and driving RCCA for non-conforming product is an added advantage.
  • Should be able to manage MRB inventory and QN count metric to customer daily.
  • Collaborating with Purchasing Team to execute return to vendor (RTV) actions and Issuing concessions to end customer.
  • Travel to various suppliers may be expected depending on the assignment.
  • Demonstrated ability to organize and prioritize a variety of activities and tasks while dealing with change.

Job Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree science or engineering fields Physics, Chemistry, Aerospace, Mechanical or Manufacturing Engineering. Will consider associate’s degree in engineering and 4 years of professional experience in manufacturing/Aerospace industry, in lieu of Bachelors or Diploma with min 7 years of relevant experience.
  • US Citizenship per ITAR regulations to comply with export compliance and site SSA requirements.
  • Strong background/experience in QNs/Concessions / MRB and in providing frontline support to manufacturing operations. Knowledge of production and aerospace components is an added advantage.
  • Good reporting and communication skills on project status and progress, lead effectively at all levels within an organization and be flexible in your approach.
  • Strong demonstrable experience of problem-solving techniques e.g. 5 why’s, 8D, DMAIC.
  • Experience in process control awareness is preferred.
  • Must be able to obtain/maintain Security Clearance.
  • Multi-tasking and dynamic capacity.
  • Proficiency with basic office computer software, specifically the Microsoft office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)..
  • Experience working with customer specifications and standards.

qualifications.required: Bachelor’s degree science or engineering fields Physics, Chemistry, Aerospace, Mechanical or Manufacturing Engineering. Will consider associate’s degree in engineering and 4 years of professional experience in manufacturing/Aerospace industry, in lieu of Bachelors or Diploma with min 7 years of relevant experience.
qualifications.preferred: US Citizenship per ITAR regulations to comply with export compliance and site SSA requirements.
